thread.title: Queensland's electorate boundary redistribution unveiled - ABC News (Australian Broadcasting Corporation)
thread.title_full: Queensland's electorate boundary redistribution unveiled - ABC News (Australian Broadcasting Corporation)

author: Chris O'Brien
title: Queensland's electorate boundary redistribution unveiled - ABC News (Australian Broadcasting Corporation)
text:
Queensland's electorate boundary redistribution unveiled By Chris O'Brien Posted February 23, 2017 19:01:38 
Sweeping changes to Queensland's electoral map will force dozens of sitting MPs and candidates to reappraise their strategy for the next election, with four extra seats and 14 renamed electorates proposed by the Redistribution Commission. 
Many boundaries have been redrawn in the biggest recalibration of seats in decades. 
Katter Party MP Shane Knuth will have to move from his current northern seat of Dalrymple to one of the two rejigged and renamed electorates — Hill or McMaster — if he is to be re-elected. 
In Brisbane, the seats of Ashgrove, Mt Coot-tha and Indooroopilly have been reshaped into two new electorates — Cooper and Maiwar — posing a pre-selection decision for Labor's Kate Jones and Steven Miles and the LNP's Scott Emerson. 
On the northern Gold Coast, Albert has been replaced and added to by the seats of Theodore and Bonney. 
The fast-growing Springfield region, west of Brisbane, has a new seat called Jordan. 
North of Brisbane and on the Sunshine Coast, new and renamed electorates include Bancroft, D'Aguilar and Ninderry. 
ALP sources claim three of the four added seats are notionally Labor, although that is disputed by the LNP. 
The draft boundaries are open for objections and comments until the end of May. 
The Liberal National Party and Opposition Leader Tim Nicholls said in a joint statement they will abide by the "umpire's decision". 
"Given the electoral changes will affect many seats, the LNP will carefully study the findings and will engage with all its MPs and candidates before providing more public comment," the statement said.
